snippet: A state appeals court ruled today that the police can close marijuana buyers' clubs despite a state law that makes it legal to use marijuana for medicinal purposes.    If allowed to operate, such clubs would set a precedent for ''marijuana to be s...
lead_paragraph: A state appeals court ruled today that the police can close marijuana buyers' clubs despite a state law that makes it legal to use marijuana for medicinal purposes. If allowed to operate, such clubs would set a precedent for ''marijuana to be sold as a loss leader or at cost in co-ops, grocery stores, liquor stores etc., or to be provided on a complimentary basis at bars, restaurants, nightclubs or casinos,'' said the ruling from the First District Court of Appeals. It held that Proposition 215, which was approved by voters in 1996 and which permitted the medical use of marijuana, did not legalize such groups.
abstract: California appeals court rules that police can close marijuana buyers' clubs despite state law that makes it legal to use marijuana for medicinal purposes (S)

headline.main: California Court Rejects Law on Marijuana
